content:
With all the talk about Busy Beaver numbers (See thread:
https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/116395-maths/topic/Turing.20machines.20.26.20gigantic.20numbers/near/448669511 ) i got curious about running a Turing machine in lean.

It it possible to use

https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Computability/TuringMachine.html#Turing-machines

to actually create and step through a TM or it it more of a theoretical library?

Conclusion: I found some good explanations in:
https://x.st/turing-machine-halting-in-lean/
Anders Larsson has marked this topic as resolved.
